Reviews.Title: “Very unfriendly clerk.”
Reviews.Author: joanneandterry
Reviews.Content: Arrived in rainstorm. Rain pouring into entrance. Man with wet vac sucking it up slower than it was coming in. Desk clerk (dark-skinned Middel Easterner) just nasty. Attitude of a skunk.

Reviews.Title: “OK with Boston Price”
Reviews.Author: krishshishya
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for college visit there in July 08, & January 09. Hotel is OK. No continental breakfast is available. The bathroom is small & the fan does not work, so it would stink so you have to wait to use after it had been used. The location is good for BU and other places. AC worked and heat was fine. No elevator. The building is old, need renovation.

Reviews.Title: “It Was An Overall Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: mrfelix
Reviews.Content: my brother and i came to boston to see the red sox play and to do some shopping/sight-seeing. we were not about to pay $200+++ to stay in town. the place was easy to find and very central to what we wanted to do. we drove everywhere with no problems(we heard boston was terrible to drive in). but we found the hotel to be clean, from the lobby to the room, which was quite large compared to some. the beds were clean, as was the bathroom. our room was at the back upstairs so the only view we had was a highway and part of a train run up on the hill. but who cares about that. we went to see boston,not sit looking out our hotel window. the staff were pleasant and helpful. and the ihop next door did not hurt my feelings. overall we both enjoyed all of our trip and are planning to come back this fall to do it again....and we will definately stay at the days inn again drmacculloch

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel”
Reviews.Author: travellingtonk
Reviews.Content: This place was the same price as the super 8 which we also stayed at for one uncomfortable night (located about 5 minutes away), but was a heck of a lot better in terms of appearance, cleanliness and facilities. We caught the 64 bus from just near the hotel to central square station, and then the subway on to boston, without any problems. The trip was probably about 30-40 minutes (including transfers).

Reviews.Title: “Misleading info from desk on bus”
Reviews.Author: YoungTexasTraveler26
Reviews.Content: I asked the woman at reservations who booked this room for me about getting from the airport. She told me to take the silver line, then the red line then bus 64. Unfortunately, the bus did not go there and I got dropped out in the middle of no where late at night. Being a young woman, I felt vulnerable and frightened. I had to walk forever hauling my luggage. Two different taxi rides later, I found this decrepit motel. I would never stay here again and the $110 which I paid should have been no more than $40. What a rip-off.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable and clean; a good value”
Reviews.Author: jaysmom4285
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times in the last year since my daughter moved to Boston. I have always found it clean and well managed. The rooms I've occupied were immaculate, and the furnishings and carpet in both the rooms and public areas appeared to be new. There were never any problems getting them to accept the internet rate at which I generally book. It is true that the property is not convenient to public transportation, which could be an issue for some but was not for me. There is a McDonald's on one side of the parking lot and an IHOP on the other, which is very convenient. I don't think that they even advertise that they provide breakfast, although there is coffee available and sometimes fruit. All in all, I felt it was a very good value for the price, which is almost always less than $100 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: beantowner2122
Reviews.Content: This place is Clean, and friendly service. I was pretty satisfied. The sheets where bright white, carpets were clean enough to walk barefoot. And most importantly, the bathroom was clean! I hate a dirty hotel bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “How much did you pay? That's how much you'll like it.”
Reviews.Author: clapyourhands
Reviews.Content: It's unfathomable to me how a property like this is in the same hotel class as places like the Hampton Inn, a chain that feels a little more high-end than it actually is. This place felt every bit as budget as the price suggests. It's shabby and run-down and desperetely in need of renovation, the beds were uncomfortable, and ventilation in the rooms was basically zip. We were quoted one price but charged another upon check-out. Oh, and did I mention that their "breakfast" package consisted of awful coffee and a basket of apples? You get what you pay for. Even if you go in with the mindset that you're only going to be sleeping there so you don't especially need your digs to be posh, there's nothing comforting about coming back to an ancient, rock-hard bed and a subpar air conditioner. Another minus is that it's so far from the subway, and who needs that in a town like Boston? As for plusses... uh, the room was actually really big. Yippee.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: K3c
Reviews.Content: The smell, the stained mattress, the windows that wouldn't open, the rude staff. Stay away, unless they offer you a deal of 39.95. Not worth a penny more.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our staying”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Days Inn Hotel in Boston Ma, on 29 of April 2006 for two nights. It was my frist trip in America, and before I go there I check the reviews in the internet about this motel and I was little bit afrad of what I will meet there. I was very happy with my staying there and really enjoyed it. The motel is very clean, quiet although my room was from the side of the road, but it was really nice. People on the reception are very helpful and there is a security man, staying there every night and that gives you the feeling of secure. There is not a breakfast at the hotel but this is not a problem at all because just next to the hotel there are two fast food restaurants (Mcdonalds and Ihop). About 2km from the hotel there are 2 shopping malls and you can go on foot only takes 20 minutes. In case I will be anywhere in America where there is a Day Inn I will stay there again without any doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is not a good place to stay. Noisy clientel, and the blood stains on the matress were more than we could stand. They did however move us to another room, but we will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: Jennhall8
Reviews.Content: A nice friendly welcome even though it was close to midnight when we arrived. Very clean room and I'm convinced the sheets were changed daily, as were all the towels. For under $100 a night for the two of us this hotel represents very good value for money. Complimentary coffee, tea and Danish pastries for breakfast included.

HotelInfo.Name: Americas Best Value Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 1800 Soldiers Field Road, Boston, MA 02135 (Formerly Charles River Motel)
